definition: to enclose/to cover with the hand (one's eyes, nose or ears)/to cover up (an affair)/contrary/to contradict
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to cover the face/to bury one's face in one's hands

sentences.english: He fights it, putting a hand over his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他忍着，把一只手捂在嘴上。

sentences.english: Samsung could have a monopoly on these amazing screens for up to a year or more.
sentences.chinese: 三星恐怕还要把这种超炫的屏幕在口袋里捂上一两年。

sentences.english: Another visitor from Zhengzhou who is surnamed Zhang passed the nude model with hands over her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 另一位来自郑州的姓张的游客捂着眼从模特身旁绕过。

sentences.english: Police suspect that she was stifled to death with a pillow.
sentences.chinese: 警察怀疑他是被枕头捂死的。

sentences.english: Don't come to bed covered up from head to toe.
sentences.chinese: 上床的时候千万不要从头到脚捂的严严实实。

sentences.english: But he clasped both his hands over his breast, and cast his eyes towards the zenith.
sentences.chinese: 但他紧握双手捂在胸前，抬眼眺望天顶。

sentences.english: Monthly wage of no secret hot, the money to the bank Carry over.
sentences.chinese: 每月的工资条还没捂热，银行卡里的钱就去了大半。

sentences.english: I keep my nose and my lips closed.
sentences.chinese: 我得一直捂好鼻子，闭紧嘴唇。

sentences.english: Time and straw make medlars ripe.
sentences.chinese: 有了时间和稻草，就能捂熟山楂。

sentences.english: You should also wash if you cough or sneeze into your hands.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用手捂嘴咳嗽或打喷嚏后也应该洗手。

definition: to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
quilt wrapped around the body as a tube (traditional bedding)/(contemporary) bedding/quilt/blankets/cover/bed
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist
palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
